full_text
@SteveC1979 Great news. You’ll recover quicker at home. Wishing you a speedy recovery. ❤️💋💕🌈🦋
@JPAndMeUK Hi Jeff. I wish you a speedy recover from the virus. Keep looking after yourself and take each day as it comes and you’ll soon be out and about on your motorbike soon. Love Linda ❤️❤️❤️
@DebbyMarr I’m so sorry for your loss. It’s so painful but I’m sure he had a brilliant life with you.
@thedebbiemcgee I do Debbie, Matt Mawford his instagram is matt.mawford. He has done some work for me.  I can put you in touch if you want ❤️💋💕🌈🦋
@pigdog666 @danwootton @talkRADIO Keep on at your doctor. A course of antibiotics might help if it’s turning into a chest infection.

@fchaps68 I’m on the mend.The main thing is that it doesn’t turn in to pneumonia. Try to keep your temperature down with paracetamol and get plenty of fresh air. Sleep with your chest as high as possible. Call 111 for antibiotics if you feel chest pains and you can’t breath properly ❤️
@SteveC1979 Brilliant news so happy you are on the mend. It takes time to get back to normal so don’t worry if you still feel tired and week in a few weeks at least you beat it. Lots of love ❤️💋🌈💕🦋
@stevem027 @TobiAnnBrown Can’t wait for the pain of losing him to subside.

@mishelle2409 @groomgraham1 Mine was a fever. No cough feeling sick no energy then not being able to breath properly then chest pains diarrhoea, sleeping all the time and just no energy.  Call 111 if you are worried x

@mishelle2409 @groomgraham1 Mine was a fever. No cough feeling sick no energy then not being able to breath properly then chest pains diarrhoea, sleeping all the time and just no energy.  Call 111 if you are worried x
@myfreecammodel @mummyking If you have a high temperature and shortness of breath and can’t get out of bed as you feel so awful then ring 111 for advice. Hope you haven’t got it x x
@fchaps68 I still can’t breath after walking up the stairs. I think it is a long recovery as the lungs have to clear all the infection and damage ❤️

Just wanted to say thank you for all your kind words. My @samkane1968 went home from hospital today to carry on recovering. We both tested positive with the virus. I still have a way to go yet The NHS staff have been amazing Their kindness keeps making me cry. Love to you all

I want to thank you all for your good wishes. Sam and I have had COVID-19 symptoms and are in isolation so we do not spread it to anyone else. We are taking it one-day-at-a-time, that’s all we can do. But let me tell you we’ve never felt this ill, EVER!
